chapter.title: Preparing and Registering Clients
chapter.para: Client registration with SUSE Manager is executed with a bootstrap script on the server which deploys all necessary information to clients. The bootstrap script contains parameters which assigns a client system to its base channel. Two of these important parameters are:

note.title: GPG Keys
note.para: GPG Keys will not be covered in this guide. For more information see: GPG Keys and Bootstrap: Reference guide

formalpara.title: Activation Keys
formalpara.para: Activation keys define the number of software entitlements, channels and groups a client system is allowed to subscribe to. This information is passed on to all systems registered with a key. Each activation key is bound to the organization for which it has been created. For this guide you will be using the default SUSE Manager organization which includes all software entitlements.

listitem.para: Create activation keys for your new client channels

sect1.title: Creating Your Keys
sect1.para: The following procedure will guide you through creating the activation keys for your two test channels.

step.para: Log in to the SUSE Manager Web interface as administrator.
Switch to the Systems tab and select Activation Keys.
Click the Create New Key link at the upper right corner.
Enter a Description to identify the generated activation key.
Enter a human readable key string value such as: SLES12-SP1 .

warning.title: Allowed Characters
warning.para: For all &suse; Products do not use commas within the key string. All other characters are allowed. Red Hat Products require commas. See: Activation Keys and rhnreg_ks: Reference Guide

step.para: Enter 1 in the Usage: field. This will allow 1 client to register using this key.
Select the &sle; 12 SP1 channel you added earlier from the Base Channels: drop down.
Select the virtualization check box as an Add-on entitlement:.
Leave the Contact Method: at default.
Leave Universal Default unchecked. Click Create Activation key to finish creating the key for the first channel.

sect1.para: Repeat this procedure from step 2 and create a key for the &sle; 11 SP4 channel and then proceed to the next section.
